item.title: John add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "This is very important -- to take leisure time. Pace is the essence. Without stopping entirely and doing nothing at all for great periods, you're gonna lose everything...just to do nothing at all, very, very important. And how many people do this in modern society? Very few. That's why they're all totally mad, frustrated, angry and hateful." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: John add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "It would take more than long-stemmed roses to change my view that you're a despicable cowardy custard and a disgrace to a proud family. Your ancestors fought in the Crusades and were often mentioned in despatches, and you cringe like a salted snail at the thought of appearing as Santa Claus before an audience of charming children who wouldn't hurt a fly. It's enough to make an aunt turn her face to the wall and give up the struggle." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: John add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "She gave me another of those long keen looks, and I could see that she was again asking herself if her favourite nephew wasn't steeped to the tonsils in the juice of the grape." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: John add a quote by Philip Larkin
item.description: "On me your voice falls as they say love should, Like an enormous yes." -- Philip Larkin

item.title: John add a quote by Philip Larkin
item.description: "Time has transfigured them into Untruth. The stone fidelity They hardly meant has come to be Their final blazon, and to prove Our almost-instinct almost true: What will survive of us is love." -- Philip Larkin

item.title: John add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "In writing, you must kill all your darlings." -- William Faulkner

item.title: John add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein
